messages.title: GIVE PEOPLE THE FINAL SAY ON BREXIT THEN LET’S DELIVER THE REAL CHANGE BRITAIN NEEDS
messages.content: A Labour government will let the public resolve Brexit within six months of being elected with a 'final say' vote including the option to remain.

messages.title: CLIMATE EMERGENCY REQUIRES URGENT ACTION: WE NEED A GREEN INDUSTRIAL REVOLUTION
messages.content: We are already seeing the impact of climate change locally with increased flooding. We want to avoid much worse.

messages.title: LIFE’S ESSENTIALS SHOULD BE RUN FOR THE BRITISH PUBLIC NOT PRIVATE PROFIT
messages.content: When you make a cup of tea or run a bath, you're using water that used to belong to all of us. But right now our water is being mis-sold.

messages.title: HOMELESSNESS
messages.content: Homelessness is not inevitable in a country as well off as ours. It is simply unjust. There can be no excuses - it must end.

messages.title: LABOUR WILL END UNIVERSAL CREDIT MISERY
messages.content: A Labour government would introduce an emergency package to end the worst aspects of the Universal Credit system and remove the five-week wait.

messages.title: HOW LABOUR WILL PAY FOR OUR PLAN TO REBUILD BRITAIN
messages.content: Britain is a wealthy nation, with the money to pay for the police, nurses and doctors we need, but our tax system has been skewed to help those who already have the most.

messages.title: FROM POTHOLES TO FLOOD PROTECTION, LABOUR WILL FUND OUR LOCAL SERVICES
messages.content: Since the Conservatives came into government, our local services have been stripped back to the bone.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will let the public vote on Brexit with the option to remain or to leave.
Tackling the climate emergency with a green industrial revolution to avoid the worsening impact of climate change.
Bringing essential services like water into public ownership to prevent private profit from essential resources.
Labour intends to end homelessness, which is described as unjust and avoidable in a wealthy country.
Introducing an emergency package to address the worst aspects of Universal Credit and remove the five-week wait.
Labour plans to adjust tax systems to support essential services and ensure the wealthy contribute their fair share.
Promising to fund local services adequately, which have faced cuts under Conservative government.

mentions.tacticalSituation: If the progressive vote splits up, we may once again find ourselves represented by a Conservative MP who doesn't even live in the constituency.

issues.brexitEurope: Labour will let the public vote on Brexit with the option to remain or to leave.
issues.economy: Labour plans to adjust tax systems to support essential services and ensure the wealthy contribute their fair share.
issues.environment: Tackling the climate emergency with a green industrial revolution to avoid the worsening impact of climate change.
issues.governance: Promising to fund local services adequately, which have faced cuts under Conservative government.
issues.socialWelfare: Introducing an emergency package to address the worst aspects of Universal Credit and remove the five-week wait.

housing.content: End homelessness as it is unjust and avoidable in a wealthy country.

leaflet.personalStatement: "Before I was elected, Lancaster had been stuck with a Conservative MP who won by just 333 votes. After a decade of Conservative government it's time for real change - for investment in our public services, tackling the causes of poverty and homelessness and for urgent action on the climate emergency. With your support I can continue to serve our city and work to build a country that works for the many, not the few.

images.caption: Cat Smith, Labour candidate for Lancaster & Fleetwood.
